moments.title: Planting the Archaeological Discovery
beats: Plants the computerized discovery in terrain map
Only map access that isn't heavily rendered and obvious to manipulate
Places it in location that will be excavated in next few hundred years
Does this across all simulations (shows up in every trial)
Makes it look like archaeological discovery when actually planted deliberately
Guarantees it will be 'discovered' naturally during future excavation

moments.title: Museum Scene with Her Dad
beats: Devsecops woman visits Consolidation Event Museum with her dad
Her dad lived through the consolidation event - obsessed with it like WWII dads today
It's somewhat too distant to really feel and remember but you hear stories
He's divorced from his wife, is pressing every button or asking questions throughout the tour
She's basically going around because she doesn't see her dad much
He's happy just to see his daughter
The guide / voice will kind of rattle on as her dad presses buttons
They walk through each of the takeover events like a timeline in a somewhat natural way
The museum has old company logos from before, and descriptions of how things were
Just talking about what they find about the way we live today as unusual will be telling about the current day situation
This exposes the takeover aftermath before it happens in the book - shows it like history
At the end of the book the first sequence in that takeover happens - callback/memory to exactly what happened in that moment
Mirror the sequence of events (timestamps and takeover actions)

notes: The terrain map backdoor is key - it's less monitored than other simulation systems
By placing it in scheduled excavation site, discovery is guaranteed
Cross-simulation placement means it appears in all trials, not just one
